1.text: Jesus then spoke to the crowds and to his disciples,

2.text: saying, “The scribes and the Pharisees have seated themselves in the chair of Moses.

3.text: Therefore, whatever they tell you to observe, observe and do, but do not imitate their works; for they preach and [yet] do not act accordingly.

4.text: Indeed, they bind heavy burdens that are dreadful to bear and put them on people’s shoulders; but they themselves will not lift a finger to help them.

5.text: Instead, they do all their works to be seen by men. They make their phylacteries broad, they enlarge the fringes of their garments,

6.text: and love the place of honor at feasts. They love the best seats in the synagogues,

7.text: the greetings in the marketplaces, and to be called ‘Rabbi, Rabbi’ by people.

8.text: But you are not to be called ‘Rabbi,’ for one is your teacher, the Christ, and all of you are brothers.

9.text: Call no man on the earth ‘your father,’ for one is your Father, he who is in heaven.

10.text: And do not be called ‘teacher,’ for one is your teacher, the Christ.

11.text: Instead, the one who is the greatest among you shall be your servant.

12.text: Whoever exalts himself will be humbled, and whoever humbles himself will be exalted.

13.text: Woe to you, scribes and Pharisees, hypocrites! For you devour widows’ houses, and as a pretense you make long prayers. Therefore, you will receive a greater condemnation.

14.text: Woe to you, scribes and Pharisees, hypocrites! Because you shut the Kingdom of Heaven in the face of people and you yourselves do not enter! And those who would enter, you prevent from doing so.

15.text: Woe to you, scribes and Pharisees, hypocrites! For you travel around by sea and land to make one convert; and when one is converted, you make him twice as much of an heir of Gehenna as yourselves.

16.text: Woe to you, you blind guides, who say, ‘If someone swears by the sanctuary, it is nothing; but whoever swears by the gold of the sanctuary is bound.’

17.text: You blind fools! Which is greater, the gold, or the sanctuary that sanctifies the gold?

18.text: You say, ‘If someone swears by the altar, it is nothing; but if someone swears by the gift that is placed on it, he is bound!’

19.text: You fools and blind [men]! Which is greater, the gift, or the altar that sanctifies the gift?

20.text: Therefore, whoever swears by the altar swears by it and by everything on it.

21.text: Whoever swears by the sanctuary swears by it and by the one who dwelt in it.

22.text: Whoever swears by heaven swears by the throne of God and by the one who sits on it.

23.text: Woe to you, scribes and Pharisees, hypocrites! For you tithe mint, dill, and cumin, but you have not fulfilled the truly significant matters of the law: justice, mercy, and faith. It is these you should have practiced, without neglecting the others.

24.text: You are blind guides who filter out a fly and yet swallow a camel!

25.text: Woe to you, scribes and Pharisees, hypocrites! For you clean the outside of the cup and the platter, but inside, they are full of greed and unrighteousness.

26.text: You blind Pharisees, first clean the inside of the cup and platter, so that the outside may also become clean.

27.text: Woe to you, scribes and Pharisees, hypocrites! For you are like whitewashed tombs which appear beautiful on the outside, but inside, they are full of dead bones and all [kinds of] impurity.

28.text: Likewise, you also appear righteous to men outwardly, but inside, you are full of hypocrisy and wickedness.

29.text: Woe to you, scribes and Pharisees, hypocrites! For you build the tombs of the prophets and decorate the tombs of the righteous,

30.text: saying, ‘If we had lived in the days of our forefathers, we would not have partaken with them in the blood of the prophets.’

31.text: Therefore, you testify to yourselves that you are children of those who killed the prophets!

32.text: Fill up, then, the measure [of sin] of your forefathers.

33.text: You serpents, offspring of vipers, how will you escape the judgment of Gehenna?

34.text: Therefore, behold, I send you prophets, wise men, and scribes. Some of them you will kill and crucify; others you will flog in your synagogues and persecute from city to city.

35.text: Thus all the righteous blood shed on the earth will come upon you, from the blood of righteous Abel to the blood of Zachariah son of Barachiah, whom you killed between the sanctuary and the altar.

36.text: Amen, I tell you: all these things will come upon this generation.

37.text: Jerusalem, Jerusalem, who kills the prophets and stones those who are sent to her! How often have I desired to gather your children, just as a hen gathers her brood under her wings; but you were not willing!

38.text: Behold, your house is left to you in a desolate state.

39.text: For I tell you, you will not see me from now on until [the day when] you are saying, ‘Blessed is he who comes in the Name of the Lord!’”
